page.title: 06WHERWELL VILLAGE
page.content: BOTH WHERWELL AND ITS NEIGHBOURING VILLAGE CHILBOLTON,ARE SET ON THE VALLEY OF THE RIVER TEST,FAMOUS FOR ITS TROUT FISHING,AND ARE IN CONSERVATION AREAS. THE VILLAGES COMPRISE OLD AND NEW PROPERTIES,SOME THATCHED,SOME BRICK AND FLINT,AND SOME WITH CHALK COB WALLS. CHILBOLTON IS BY FAR THE LARGER VILLAGE ,EXPANDING A GREAT DEAL IN LATTER YEARS. WHERWELL IS SITUATED ON A CHALK CLIFF AND IS FOR THE MOST PART STILL AN ESTATE VILLAGE BELONGING TO LADY BRECKNOCK. SHE LIVES IN WHERWELL PRIORY,MENTIONED IN THE FIRST DOOMSDAY BOOK.THE PRIORY IS OPEN ONCE A YEAR TO RAISE MONEY FOR ST.JOHN'S AMBULANCE BRIGADE. MANY COTTAGES IN THE VILLAGE ARE OCCUPIED BY PEOPLE WORKING ON THE ESTATE,INCLUDING GAME KEEPERS,WATER KEEPERS,BUTLER,SHEPHERDS,FARM WORKERS AND A CHAUFFEUR.
